inference:
**Solution:**

If $x < 2$, then $f(f(x)) = f(ax+b) = 8-3(ax+b) = 8-3ax-3b = x.$ This gives $8-3ax-3b=x,$ so $8-x=3ax+3b.$

If $x \ge 2$, then $f(f(x)) = f(8-3x) = a(8-3x) + b = 8a-3ax+b = x.$ This gives $8a-3ax+b=x,$ so $8a-x=3ax-b.$

We have two equations:

$$\begin{align*}
8-x&=3ax+3b\\
8a-x&=3ax-b
\end{align*}$$

Subtracting the second equation from the first, we get $8-x-(8a-x)=3ax+3b-(3ax-b)$, which simplifies to $-7a=2b.$ Therefore, $a+b=\boxed{-\frac{3}{7}}.$

**Final Answer: \(\boxed{-\frac{3}{7}}\). I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
Setting $x = 3,$ we get $f(3) = -1.$ Since $-1 < 2,$ $f(-1) = -a + b.$ Hence, $f(f(3)) = f(-1) = -a + b.$ But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $-a + b = 3.$

Setting $x = 4,$ we get $f(4) = -4.$ Since $-4 < 2,$ $f(-4) = -4a + b.$ Hence, $f(f(4)) = f(-4) = -4a + b.$ But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $-4a + b = 4.$

Subtracting the equations $-a + b = 3$ and $-4a + b = 4,$ we get $3a = -1,$ so $a = -1/3.$ From $-a + b = 3,$ we get $b = a + 3 = 8/3.$ Hence, $$a + b = (-1/3) + 8/3 = \boxed{\frac{7}{3}}.$$

Setting $x = 4,$ we get $f(4) = -4.$ Since $-4 < 2,$ $f(-4) = -4a + b.$ Hence, $f(f(4)) = f(-4) = -4a + b.$ But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $-4a + b = 4.$
